stanza.line: O never say that I was false ofheart
Though absence seemed my flame to qualify
As easy might I from my selfdepart
As from my soul which in thy breast doth lie
That is my home of love if I haveranged
Like him that travels I returnagain
Just to the time not with the timeexchanged
So that my self bring water for mystain
Never believe though in my naturereigned
All frailties that besiege all kinds of blood
That it could so preposterously bestained
To leave for nothing all thy sum of good
For nothing this wide universe Icall
Save thou my rose in it thou art myall
